storyInfo: The remaining Church of the Deep cultists reach an agreement with Thiago. Kal'tsit and Carmen are delayed, and there is no time to wait at the Eye of Iberia. The Hunters and Irene decide to go ahead and locate the great ship.

attributes.content: We're almost at our destination.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What? You'd never would've reached the Stultifera in one piece without me. The children of the sea would've ripped you apart, crushed you, or bound your limbs as they dragged you off to their nests.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You're not like Quintus.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: What might could you be talking about? My skin? This sack of flesh?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: None of that matters.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What are you trying to accomplish?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And what are YOU trying to accomplish, Hunter? Your kind already loathe your enemies while simultaneously doubting the purity of your own blood. But still... you pretend to be calm.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What are you trying to get out of me?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Silence. A wise choice. Ægir are not a sociable lot, it is known. But it seems there are exceptions.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Or, are you just a bit of an unpopular grump?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I can answer your question. Quintus wouldn't, nor will other humans. But the Seaborn will. Like Heralds, we come to understand things. We are not limited by the way humans think.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I don't need your riddles.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Before coming here, I was in the midst of translating a literary classic from Ursus. It was about race and nations. About history. I was putting it into Iberian and Victorian.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Take a look, Mister Hunter.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Ulpianus's gaze follows the woman's hand, his eyes subconsciously drawn towards the ocean.
A pitch-black sea. Dense with dark clouds. Oppressive. And yet, a vague outline of the starry sky is visible.
Even the Ægir rarely look out across the ocean from the water's surface. Different races, different countries. The land is fractured in every sense, and its conflicts are neverending.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But when you look over the boundless sea, do you see anything representing those divides?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Tch... These damn monsters!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Jordi! Are you alright?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Slithering sounds, rubbing against the wall)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: G-Get away from me—!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Seems like activating this facility has made these poor creatures realize that this place doesn't make a very good nest.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: High Inquisitor!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Keep ascending, Ægir. Your hands are for wielding tools, not fire and steel.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: The plan is unchanged. Go with Irene and find what the Inquisition and the Hunters are seeking.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: I, I know! Please be careful!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Do you really think we can find that ship?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It can only pass through Iberia.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I don't understand... If it is a place like Rhodes Island, why hasn't it tried to return in sixty years?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We too are lost, unable to find a way back home. Is that not so?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (Sounds of stirring, slapping the water)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: The children are increasing in number.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Are you alright?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Me? Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You didn't speak a single word on the way to Iberia.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Have you always seen me as a chatterbox, Skadi?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Skadi stares deeply into Specter's eyes.
When she'd finally found Laurentina on land, her eyes were clouded over.
Then she saw it in Sal Viento. A fragment of Laurentina as she was. But it was short-lived. After returning to Rhodes Island, she seemed to have fallen back into the abyss.
But now, Skadi begins to find herself unable to distinguish which corner of Specter's mind she is currently dealing with.
She has an ominous guess.
One that has always swirled through her mind.
What's the matter?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No need to overthink this, Skadi.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And the same goes for you, my sleepy little mermaid. We don't have much time. You will awaken.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Will I?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You will.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: For the time being... Go with Shark and take out the small fry. Their numbers are endless, so remember to adjust your breathing and conserve energy.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You should already know that I prefer it that way.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...Must we be in such a hurry to perform again? The storm is not yet ready.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Heh, but it seems our dance partner won't be kept waiting.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Tch, there's no end to them.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Doña Irene!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You're still alive! So that flash of light was from the High Inquisitor's lantern after all!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Um, he wanted us to continue on... But what exactly should we do? Keep searching for the ship's location?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I was originally planning to wait for the technicians to arrive, but seeing how you got this big fella started all by yourself—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Hiss... Hiss...
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: —Make every second count!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Thiago? So you're finally seeing clearly.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Why haven't you fled? The Penal Battalion and that Inquisitor have been lying in ambush in town.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Then why haven't your proud townspeople returned?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: The Inquisitors have already taken away all the confused, directionless residents of Gran Faro, and you already know what's going to happen to them.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: You know all too well.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: But I can't sit by and watch Gran Faro go up in smoke. I have to do whatever I can.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You? Fight the Inquisition? Fair enough, Thiago. But that will only hasten the town's demise. Iberia will never tolerate an act of treason.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: While we welcome all into our fold, but the weak do not have that right. This 'determination' of yours is but a sick joke your mind is playing on you. You understand nothing. Who do you think you're talking to?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Who? If I'd cared enough to investigate, you would've been flushed out by the Penal Battalion long ago.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Tell me then, what can people like you offer Gran Faro?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: In the end, this town is... a mere human settlement.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: What we seek to offer up to this land is of a much higher calling than your meaningless baubles.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: (A slithering sound emerges from cracks in the building)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: You've been followed.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Hiss...
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Hah, these Sea Terrors have pretty sharp senses.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: An outsider? We will allow it. Your flesh and blood shall become nourishment for our wounded. We all give back to this land.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Tch, the nethersea brand has already reached this far. The walls, the stairs, it's all over the place!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Are you still not done yet? They're getting closer!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Almost there!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: How does this make any sense? Even after all these years, the signal-receiving devices are still operable... But why? How?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Oh, the logs—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: —Woah, there it is! Now let's take a look—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Hiss...
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Ugh—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Their numbers are exploding! They're moving through the nethersea brand, as if they've merged with the ground entirely!)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (At this rate, even Maestro and the Hunters won't be able to stay in this branded place for much longer...)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Rough sounds of slithering across the floor)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Damn it— Underneath us! Jordi!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Wh-What?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Continue.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ah, um... Okay...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Abyssal Hunters!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You're too weak. Swarms like this require swifter movements. Spare yourself the energy to breathe.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Like so.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Urgh...!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: How much longer, Ægir?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Th-There are no records in the logs of how to operate these information terminals, so I'll have to keep searching—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: —There's some data here... I don't understand what it means, but it keeps popping up!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Keeps popping up? Even if that's from the Inquisition's last attempt, that should've been years ago!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I, I'm not sure. I assumed the data loss was caused by a power outage, b-but—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If my hypothesis is right...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: There's a ship that's been sending signals to this lighthouse for decades!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: How far away it is?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I know, I'm looking... Ugh, where are the navigation records—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...It's very close.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: How can it be... so close?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Waaaah!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Wh-What happened?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I'm afraid the underground portion of the tower has been swallowed up by the nethersea brand.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We need to make our decision, now!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Decision? What decision? If we have the means to locate the ship, then we will go.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No! We should eradicate the Sea Terrors to ensure that the Penal Battalion's reinforcements can arrive safely!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Impossible. You will merely wear yourselves out before the stronger prey can even join the hunt.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Or do you mean to say that Iberia has hundreds upon thousands of people willing to hold the line to their dying breath, like the High Inquisitor below us?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No, but—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Opportunity waits for no one.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Have you confirmed the coordinates?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ah, um, I can determine an approximate range, but I don't know why it's spinning around, or if that means—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It is being kept afloat by aberrant ocean currents. See that square surrounded by Seaborn? That's what the ship looks like now.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But, that ship is the only vessel we have.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You can have it. We don't need it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Go with them.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: High Inquisitor?! What did you just say?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The Eye of Iberia has already been activated. There should still be some working safeguards in place.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Lord Carmen will arrive to purge the evil remaining along these shores. We don't have time to waste on these endless hordes.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Th-Then, I'll stay with you, sir!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: No. You ought to accompany them.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You should go see the ocean.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: What saved your life, what let the rescuers find you... wasn't me. It was the Scriptures you hold in your hand.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Make the right choice. Do not bring shame to Iberia.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Understood, High Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I will become Iberia's eyes, and return the Stultifera to our country's embrace.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Then go.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: I look forward to seeing the moment you pass down the correct verdict.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Yes, High Inquisitor!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You should leave too. Go with them.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Sir... I don't want to. I want to stay here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's too dangerous.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: I don't know a single thing about that golden vessel. The best I could do is bask in its magnificence, but... I don't think that's where my duty lies.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I, um, this might be a strange thing to say, but I... I only felt my own worth when I was exploring this lighthouse, so—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Please, let me stay here.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Exactly one hundred down. But nothing has changed.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: They're like stars in the sky.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Breaking the encirclement would be simple, but defending the lighthouse? How long would we be slashing away?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What a fine, colorful carpet they make as their carcasses dissolve.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: A carpet of life... Ah, this must be the most beautiful carpet in the land.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (True, the nethersea brand is spreading, which means...)
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Your weapons cannot burn them, but mine can.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: That's only a temporary solution. Cauterizing the tips of the seagrass won't stop it from growing.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It's good enough. Grab your people and get out of here. Steer the ship out, or you won't be able to get your bearings.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You realize what that means.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You don't need to tell me, Ægir.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Very well. Do your best to survive, High Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Shark, Skadi!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: That's the ship...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: After so long spent waiting on land, we are finally about to return to Ægir. We...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia's words slow to a halt.
Her hand caresses her neck. On her well-concealed skin is a patch that is rough to the touch.
The ship is right in front of her eyes. —No, don't be hasty, Gladiia. The ocean is still dangerous. Otherwise, it would not have trapped the three Hunters ashore.
But without a doubt, her heart is smoldering.
They've left.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's right. Which means we're stranded here until the Penal Battalion's reinforcements arrive.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You've done well, Ægir, so you've earned the right to answer a question.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Ah, o-okay! I swear to answer truthfully!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Did you make your own decision to leave the shore, and come here with us?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You're just an ordinary person. Janitor or whatever, you are no warrior. Few can wander out to sea, let alone witness a battle against the Sea Terrors.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Yet... Look, your expression doesn't shake at all under the light of my lantern. What are you thinking? What do you want?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: I can't even remember ever seeing my mother or father. Everyone always told me I'm an Ægir, and that we came here to repair the lighthouse. But it's all ruined.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I... Before all this, I didn't know a single thing. I was lost and confused. To be honest, when the Sea Terrors came, Thi— Someone told me to leave as soon as possible. But...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Truthfully, I didn't even know where I could go.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Because I'm an Ægir, all I can do is keep my head down as I trudge through life. And, um... just so you know, I'm actually a chapel nurse, not a janitor.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But that doesn't really count as work, does it? All the things Mr. Elysium talks about, the way he acts... Maybe that's what it really means to live life upon this land.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's why... I felt like this was an opportunity.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Are you not afraid of death?
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: I don't think there's anyone who isn't, sir.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I should be frank with you. The nethersea brand has already completely engulfed the coastline. We don't have much time left.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Lord Carmen and Dr. Kal'tsit may have their methods, but I'm not so optimistic.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: When the others left, we were basically condemned to death.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Is... that why you insisted on me going with them?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's too late to regret it now. You chose to defy me, of your own free will. But even if you die here, your death would be by no means meaningless.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You're not shaken.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Haha... Just a little bit, maybe. But even if I went with them, wouldn't I still have nine-to-one odds of dying?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: As long as I stay here in this lighthouse, I can at least feel like I've already—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Don't be in such a hurry to give up.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: The Eye of Iberia should have its own defenses. Go start them up.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Ah, alright. But, where will you go?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Now...
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: We are alone at sea, far from our homeland.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Again and again we arrive on this little reef, the weight of our lives and of our vessels so much heavier than the place itself.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: ...Hiss...
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: (Swarms of slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Between the ocean and Iberia, there is no such thing as justice... or evil.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Only sword and lantern—
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Only me.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario
